entry.title: Farewell to the Penny: America’s 238-Year-Old Coin Reaches Its End
entry.summary: After 238 years, the U.S. Mint has retired the penny. Officials cite rising production costs as retailers and consumers now face rounding challenges and legal questions over exact change. Existing pennies will remain legal tender as the nation adjusts to life without its oldest coin.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 11.12.25
entry.summary: Live from Salem, State Senator David Brock Smith has an update on the federal funding for an Oregon State Veterans Home in Roseburg, a look at the transportation package just signed and other topics.

entry.title: Mercy Flights and Ashland Community Health Foundation Announce $350,000 Grant
entry.summary: Mercy Flights will launch a groundbreaking pilot program thanks to a generous grant of $350,000 fromthe Ashland Community Health Foundation (ACHF). The 12-month initiative will bring emergencymedical care directly into the home of seniors and veterans across Jackson County while reducingunnecessary emergency department visits. Mercy Flights is expanding its community-based care programs, including Alternative Destinations… The post Mercy Flights and Ashland Community Health Foundation Announce $350,000 Grant appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Fire Damages Manufactured Home on Brosi Orchard Road in Winston
entry.summary: Fire crews quickly knocked down a blaze that damaged a manufactured home off Brosi Orchard Road in Winston Tuesday evening. All occupants and their dog escaped safely. No injuries were reported, but the cause of the fire remains undetermined due to extensive damage.

entry.title: What Douglas County should know about the Mediterranean oak borer
entry.summary: A press release from the Oregon Department of Forestry (ODF) said that Oregon is now home to a new invasive, destructive tiny beetle. The Mediterranean oak borer (MOB) has been found in multiple places in northern Oregon.

entry.title: Hundreds Line Streets for Roseburg’s 70th Annual Veterans Day Parade
entry.summary: Hundreds to even thousands gathered downtown for Roseburg’s 70th Annual Veterans Day Parade, featuring veterans groups, bands, scouts, fire departments, and community organizations honoring local service members and celebrating seven decades of tradition.

entry.title: Rising Costs Lead Yoncalla to Drop Sheriff’s Office Contract
entry.summary: The Yoncalla City Council voted unanimously to end its contract with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office, citing higher costs and limited funds. The agreement for patrol and ordinance enforcement will officially end December 31, 2025.

entry.title: Winston Middle School Students Walk Out to Protest Bullying, Call for Safer Schools
entry.summary: More than 35 Winston Middle School students walked out Monday afternoon, protesting bullying and demanding accountability. Parents and students say the demonstration highlights ongoing safety concerns and a need for stronger anti-bullying action.
